name: Cambodia
description: Cambodia, officially the Kingdom of Cambodia, is a Southeast Asian nation bordered by Thailand to the west, Laos to the northwest, Vietnam to the east, and the Gulf of Thailand to the south. Known for its rich history, stunning temples, and diverse landscapes, Cambodia offers a unique blend of ancient culture and natural beauty. The country’s geography ranges from the fertile plains of the central lowlands to the Cardamom Mountains in the southwest and the highlands of Ratanakiri and Mondulkiri in the northeast.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and largest city of Cambodia.
quickFacts.detail: Phnom Penh is a vibrant metropolis with a mix of modern development and historical landmarks.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Cambodia is predominantly Khmer.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population lives in rural areas, relying on agriculture.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Khmer is a tonal language with a complex writing system.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Cambodian Riel is the official currency, but the US dollar is widely accepted.
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but generally, 1 USD equals approximately 4,000 KHR.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Cambodia is a relatively small country.
quickFacts.detail: It's roughly the size of South Carolina.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Cambodia's economy is largely based on agriculture and tourism.
quickFacts.detail: The country is experiencing steady economic growth.

climateData.title: Cambodia's Climate
climateData.description: Cambodia experiences a tropical monsoon climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. The southwest (Cardamom Mountains) is generally cooler and wetter than the central and northeast regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings sunny skies, lower humidity, and pleasant temperatures. It's the peak tourist season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season is marked by heavy rainfall, high humidity, and occasional flooding. However, it's also a beautiful time to experience the lush landscapes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Hot Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures rise significantly during this period, making it a challenging time for outdoor activities.

naturalWonders.name: Angkor Wat
naturalWonders.description: Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument in the world, a magnificent temple complex built in the 12th century. It's a testament to the Khmer Empire's architectural and artistic prowess.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Originally dedicated to the Hindu god Vishnu, it was later transformed into a Buddhist temple. Its intricate carvings and towering structures are a sight to behold.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for historical context

naturalWonders.name: Cardamom Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The Cardamom Mountains are a vast, relatively untouched rainforest in southwestern Cambodia. They are home to a diverse array of wildlife and offer incredible trekking opportunities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These mountains are a crucial biodiversity hotspot, harboring numerous endangered species. The terrain is rugged and challenging, requiring experienced hikers.

naturalWonders.name: Kampot Bay
naturalWonders.description: Kampot Bay is a stunning stretch of coastline known for its pepper plantations, lush hills, and serene beaches. It's a popular destination for relaxation and water activities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The bay is surrounded by rolling hills covered in pepper farms, creating a picturesque landscape. The beaches offer calm waters perfect for swimming and kayaking.
viewingTips: Take a boat trip along the bay

ecosystemData.title: Cambodia's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Cambodia’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from tropical rainforests and mangrove forests to grasslands and wetlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, many of which are found nowhere else on Earth.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Cambodia’s forests are vital for carbon sequestration, biodiversity conservation, and watershed protection.

notableSpecies.name: Asian Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the forest ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Sumatran Orangutan
notableSpecies.significance: A flagship species for conservation efforts.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangrove Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Cambodia’s mangrove forests provide crucial coastal protection, nursery grounds for fish, and habitat for numerous species.

statistics.details: The largest mangrove forest in Southeast Asia.

notableSpecies.name: Mudskipper
notableSpecies.significance: An indicator species for mangrove health.

notableSpecies.name: Mangrove Crab
notableSpecies.significance: A key component of the mangrove food web.

biodiversityCategory.name: Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Cambodia is a birdwatcher's paradise, boasting a diverse range of avian species, including migratory birds.

statistics.details: Pass through Cambodia during the dry season.

notableSpecies.name: Asian Mystic
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered bird found only in Cambodia.

activities.title: Activities in Cambodia
activities.description: Cambodia offers a wide range of activities for travelers, from exploring ancient temples to trekking through jungles and relaxing on pristine beaches.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Cambodia’s diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Cardamom Mountains Trek
activities.description: Trek through the dense rainforests of the Cardamom Mountains, encountering diverse wildlife.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, insect repellent, water bottle

activities.name: Phnom Kulen Hike
activities.description: Hike to the waterfalls and temples of Phnom Kulen, a sacred site for Cambodians.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities along Cambodia’s coastline and rivers.

activities.name: Koh Rong Snorkeling & Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Koh Rong.

activities.name: Tonle Sap River Cruise
activities.description: Take a boat trip on the Tonle Sap River and visit floating villages.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, including a jacket and sweater

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, backpack, water bottle, map, compass
